main event: A bright, shiny, round object was observed at a high altitude, moving in a straight path from horizon to horizon near Aldan, Michigan on August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The object was initially reported as a possible weather balloon, but other similar reports were considered.
Three civilians reported observing unidentified flying objects to the local police department, who then asked the Air Force to investigate.
One person took a photograph of an unidentified object, which the Air Force believed to be a satellite (Echo II).
The reports described the objects as varying in color from red to white to green, and moving from stationary to steady movement in a northeast direction.
The sightings lasted anywhere from 15 minutes to 8 minutes.
result: Identified as likely a weather balloon or satellite (Echo II)
witnesses: Civilians, sheriff's department, and Air Force personnel
photographs: Yes, one photograph was taken but not included in the report
